meanings.definition: A person who frisks or searches for something.
meanings.sent1: The frisker found the missing keys under the couch.
meanings.sent2: The museum security guard was a diligent frisker, always on the lookout for any misplaced artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The frisker at the airport chuckled as he discovered a forgotten sandwich in a passenger's bag.
meanings.sent4: She was a skilled frisker, able to uncover hidden treasures in the most unexpected places.
meanings.sent5: The young detective imagined himself as a fearless frisker, solving mysteries with his keen eye.

meanings.definition: A device used for frisking or searching.
meanings.sent1: The security team used a high-tech frisker to scan all incoming packages.
meanings.sent2: The airport installed new friskers to enhance their security measures.
meanings.sent3: The frisker beeped loudly when it detected a metal object in the bag.
meanings.sent4: The frisker's screen displayed a detailed image of the item hidden in the luggage.
meanings.sent5: The portable frisker was lightweight and easy to carry around for inspections.

meanings.definition: To search someone for concealed weapons or contraband.
meanings.sent1: The security officer had to frisk every visitor before allowing them into the event.
meanings.sent2: The police officer frisked the suspect for any illegal substances.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly asked the audience to frisk him for hidden cards.
meanings.sent4: She felt violated when the security personnel frisked her at the entrance.
meanings.sent5: The customs officer had to frisk each passenger for prohibited items before they could board the plane.
